page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT
page.content: The two main sources of employment for the inhabitants in the area are shipbuilding and electronics.Over the years the work force in the "Yards" As they are locally known has declined drastically.Like all the other Shipbuilders in the U.K. the Upper Clyde Shipbulders have suffered from the effects of a decline in World Shipping.Their inability to compete with the Shipbuilding Countries in the Far East for a share in a very limited market has also been a major factor in the decline.At present the work force are building an Oil Rig but there are no orders on their Books and this could result in a complete closure of the Yards.The huge I.B.M.Complex contnues to thrive and is by far the healthiest industry in the area.
